definition: to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: If a crime is constituted, he shall be transferred to the department of justice and subject to criminal liabilities.
sentences.chinese: 构成犯罪的，依法移交司法机关追究其刑事责任。

sentences.english: Then there is the problem that all transitions are bureaucratic nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 最后，移交是一个行政程序上的令人心悸的麻烦事。

sentences.english: The suspected drug dealer will be returned to the US on January 5.
sentences.chinese: 这名嫌犯将于1月5日被移交回美国。

sentences.english: Inquiry , indeed , is a work which devolves upon experts.
sentences.chinese: 探究确实是移交给专家的一项工作。

sentences.english: Involved in serious violations of law, the transfer of the judiciary.
sentences.chinese: 涉及严重违法违纪行为的，移交司法部门处理。

sentences.english: For serious cases, will be handed over to the public security organs.
sentences.chinese: 对于情节严重者，会将线索移交给公安执法机关。

sentences.english: He has been conducted to police headquarters, where he is being subjected to a thorough examination.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已被移交警察总部接受彻查。

sentences.english: In the Agile development visualization shown in Figure 5, no "handoffs" can be seen.
sentences.chinese: 而在图5所示的敏捷开发中，并没有看到“移交物”。

sentences.english: "Taking-Over Certificate" means a certificate issued pursuant to Clause 48.
sentences.chinese: “移交证书”指按照第48条之规定颁发的一种证书。

sentences.english: 1984 - United Kingdom agrees handover of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 1984年的今天，英国同意香港的移交。

sentences.english: So, Klaette like a prisoner of war as being transferred to the Issa hands.
sentences.chinese: 于是，科莱特又像战俘一样地被移交给了埃萨里。

sentences.english: If necessary, I hand over the situation to someone else and return later.
sentences.chinese: 如果有必要，我将事情移交给其他人，之后再回来。

sentences.english: His duties have been assumed by the Lieutenant Governor during his recovery.
sentences.chinese: 在地方官康复期间，他的权利已经移交给主管上尉。

sentences.english: It is believed that China is still building Mings, with 21 delivered so far.
sentences.chinese: 据信中国仍在制造明级，至今也移交了21艘。

sentences.english: Of those cases, 5,373 have been referred to the courts for criminal persecution.
sentences.chinese: 其中5373人已移交法院追究刑事责任。

sentences.english: It was Taiwan's second democratic transfer of power, after eight years of rule by the pro-independence party.
sentences.chinese: 这是台湾第二次民主移交权力。

definition: to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to handle/to take care of/to punish
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
